elements.title: crowned queen at his side
elements.contents: ... that despite it being announced in 2005 that she would not bear the title, Charles III's wife, Camilla (both pictured), is to be crowned queen at his side?

elements.title: Alfredo Frohlich
elements.contents: ... that Alfredo Frohlich formed an award-winning collection of Panamanian postal history that included items from as early as 1777?

elements.title: 1957 Latin Cup
elements.contents: ... that the top goalscorer of the 1957 Latin Cup scored all three goals in the same match?

elements.title: Dracul
elements.contents: ... that the book Dracul makes use of the unpublished first 100 pages of Bram Stoker's Dracula manuscript?

elements.title: Tickner Edwardes
elements.contents: ... that Tickner Edwardes was a beekeeper who wrote the earliest published account of hitchhiking?

elements.title: first known texts written by Brazilian indigenous people
elements.contents: ... that the first known texts written by Brazilian indigenous people, written in 1645, were only completely translated in 2021?

elements.title: Bettye Crutcher
elements.contents: ... that Bettye Crutcher, the only female staff songwriter for Stax Records, wrote songs for B.B. King, Johnnie Taylor, and the Staple Singers?

elements.title: a pigeon
elements.contents: ... that in 1916 the French appointed a pigeon to the Legion of Honour?
